meanings.definition: Corresponding in size or degree; in proportion.
meanings.sent1: The amount of effort she put in was commensurate with the results she achieved.
meanings.sent2: His salary was commensurate with his experience and qualifications.
meanings.sent3: The clown wore shoes commensurate with the size of a giant, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was commensurate with the warmth of the sun on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room was commensurate with the anticipation of a surprise party.

meanings.sent1: The twins had commensurate heights, making it hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent2: The portions of cake were commensurate, ensuring everyone got a fair share.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce, with both teams showing commensurate skill.
meanings.sent4: Their love was commensurate to the vastness of the ocean, deep and endless.
meanings.sent5: The joy on their faces was commensurate with winning a grand prize.

meanings.sent1: The dress was commensurate for the formal event, elegant and fitting.
meanings.sent2: His words were commensurate with the seriousness of the situation, calming and wise.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a box commensurate in size to its desire for a cozy nap.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was commensurate with the happiness of a child on a playground.
meanings.sent5: The music was commensurate with the mood of the party, lively and upbeat.
